intro: Ceropegia maccoyiana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant produces showy, violet-colored blooms that attract specific pollinators, such as moths.
